reviews.review: The devs just announced on Twitter that they're releasing NFTs of Dead by Daylight. Take this game off the Steam store now.
Gave the company my money for the hellraiser dlc then went on to make an NFT against their promises, fun game but the company's shit

I would've absolutely said yes despite all the bugginess, the latency issues with servers, the improper balancing, one thing fixing and another thing breaking with every patch, i still would've said yes this game is fun and will grab you by the throat with how the gameplay works. and then they announced NFTs for this new chapter LMAOOOO please do not support this dog water company making decisions like this. Like 99% of the playerbase is fuming because of it for obvious reasons, so just dont bother until they fix their shit honestly
yeah
It's fun
Я тунелер и кемпер(((((((((((...................(мне абсолютно поxуй)
Was a good game but the devs support NFTs and lied about it :)))

I always felt like this game was in a hard space, because you have to constantly balance killers and the survivors. 
With a group of friends it can be a really fun game (provided you don't get in a lobby with a killer cheating or abusing some absurd exploit with their set of skills)

Though after steadily seeing less and less about changes and ignoring valid criticism about the current game state, Behavior Interactive have decided to further creep into the more predatory side of game development; and released that they'll be adding NFT's into the newest chapter. 
I can already see where this game is going and it breaks my heart because it was a staple game for me and my friends when we couldn't think of what to play.
This is so blatantly about money for them, that they'd hop on the money laundering trend too.

Also the only thing they've said on it so far is to give out 100k bloodpoints like that'll smooth it all over,
[u]absolutely tone deaf and out of touch with the reality of its playerbase.[/u]

Valve has also stated that they wouldn't allow blockchain or NFT's to be sold through games or their platform so it'll be important to see how BI handles this(as well as see if valve holds to their word on the matter)

TLDR: game was pretty fun with friends even if hackers/cheaters made it absolutely awful. 
          This touch into NFT's just shows that they'll use any means to take as much money 
          from you as they can so they can to cash out on the scam trend that it is.
          I personally can't recommend giving Behavior Interactive any business at this time.
It is annoying sometimes, but mostly fun.
Juego qliao malo
it's a good game but theres problems that still need to be fixed
fuck nfts. fix this shit

this game suck big balls

I've bought this game 3 times, on 3 different platforms, and I've put a decent amount of time into it. This game has it's genuinely satisfying moments, and it has the potential to be enjoyable. There is [i]some[/i] fun to be had in this game in its current state, although admittedly the fun moments are few and far between in its current state.

However, the devs of the game do not care about what their players want. They do not care about making the game fair and balanced for both sides, and they certainly don't care about the longevity of their game. Every DLC has featured characters that were more and more unfair. There is an insane amount of powercreep in this game. This game used to have substance and actual content, and I had hope for the future of this game. Dead by Daylight has become nothing more than a money grab. No real effort has been put into this game in years. 

In light of their most recent money-making scheme, a set of NFTs relating to the newest chapter, I've uninstalled this game, likely to never return. In doing this, they have shown that they truly do not care about their fans opinions. They have shown how far out of touch with both reality and their players they really are. I hope steam removes this game off their catalog in line with their recent policy. I wish I could say I got this game for free, because I am truly ashamed to have spent money on something that turned out to be a massive waste of my time.

Made by a lying company who focus on skins and NFT partnerships over making sure the game is still playable, uninstalling until they seriously reevaluate what they're doing and the bridges they're burning with the player base.
so fun when playing with friends. So many laughs and screams. I play hours straight. One of my top games

I bought this game all the way back in July, 2016. In the past 5 years I've wasted about 2k+ hours on this game.
I guess I can't say wasted, it was fun in the beginning. It really was, it was unlike any game I've ever played. It's been going downhill for arguably 2 years or so. I'm sure that changes depending on who you ask, but that's my take on it. 
The Devs are money hungry. They genuinely don't care about the longevity of this game and it shows. Their greed WILL be the end of this game, and I'm sure you can guess why based on other reviews posted at this time. They really only care about getting new players, and those new players will quickly become "old" players and they'll be slapped with the hard truth that the devs do NOT care about your gaming experiences. Shitty hitboxes, 5 year old bugs, toxic players, constant DC's, a huge wave of hackers. I'm sure I'm missing many other points.
Beyond the Devs constant excuses and blatant disregard for any helpful tips on this game, the community is very toxic. I'm not saying *everyone* is, but more often than not you will be met with pure toxicity and nothing else. 
If you would have asked me 2 years ago if I'd recommend this game, I would say absolutely. Now I'm going to tell you to save your time and money. If you want fun matches for about 100-200 hours then go for it, the devs literally only care about the health of this game for new players so you'll be having a good time. But I wouldn't waste my time. I'm sad to say this game will end up in the graveyard of games in my library, but I guess they'll end up there in due time. 
I wish this game took a different turn. It had so much potential. But after their most recent stunt with NFTs, I can't trust this game or the company behind it anymore. BHVR single handedly ruined the trust of its players and many, many content creators/streamers who loved this game and gave them the benefit of the doubt for YEARS. 
Hope this helps you chose to not get this game.

dead by daylight WAS A good game, until they decided to release the hellraiser chapter and didnt tell anyone who bought it that they were unwittingly supporting NFT's that they were working for months on prior to release. a really shitty way of doing business and a really easy way to get rid of players

I won't be diving into the scandal that all other recent reviews are mentioning, but it is part of the reason that I am now giving a negative review.

Quite simply, fun game, shame about the greed. Even before the NFT debacle started, the monetization of this game was particularly abhorrent. Its confusingly laid out dlc bundles are only the tip of the iceberg, there's a microtransactions system which is, quite frankly, insulting in how much they expect you to dole out for cosmetics, in addition to a season pass system, and now apparently lootboxes in the form of NFTs, because just having illegal gambling wasn't bad enough.

I picked up this game about a month back. I got the ultimate edition on sale for about 20 bucks, which is what they want you to pay for the base game itself. And I can easily tell you that, no, even that wasn't worth the money for getting into this money-making shell of a game.
Lied to the community about their involvement in NFTs. Worked on an NFT project for months instead of fixing their broken and buggy game. Do not buy.

They added NFT transactions instead of fixing the litany of issues with console, hackers, disconnects and poor balancing. Your money isn't going to the development of the game, it's going into their pockets. 

If you still want to buy it I ain't gonna hate on you, it's your money and your choice. The game will very likely never die, but I feel kind of gross giving them money anymore. I played my 120 hours and I had some fond memories, I'll be moving on now.

so a while ago i wrote a review about how i hate behaviour entertainment, but that's not really a dbd review, is it. it is only right for me to redo it and truly explain why dbd is mankind's worst creation.

way back in the old days, the old days that i did not firsthand experience, dbd was a messy but fun little game about hiding from a man with bear traps. everything about it was very simple and stealth oriented. nobody really knew what they were doing, and everyone played it the way that you would play, you know, a horror game.

present day dbd is an intensely competitive and strategic experience. the game isn't about stealth anymore, it's about, in a word, looping. looping is the strategy in which the survivors try to keep running the killer around for as long as possible while their teammates finish the generators so that they can escape the trial. conversely, the killer wants to finish those chases as quickly as possible so that they can hook and eventually kill as many survivors as possible, all while trying to put pressure on the gens to prevent them from being repaired. people play it like a strategy-action game, not a horror game.

there's another thing that present dbd is: A MONEY PRINTING MACHINE. before i can explain that, you need to understand the extreme difference between the survivor and killer side. there's a constant raging war over whether the game is killer or survivor sided, and while it's not the most useful of arguments, the fact that it exists does matter. there's a huge contrast between the way that killers and survivors play. you'll tend to find more casual players leaning towards survivor, and more intense players going for killer. this isn't just because of the gameplay itself, but the fact that when you buy a new survivor, it's more of a skin than anything else. every survivor has the same set of abilities, the only differences being the way that they look, the way that they sound, and the perks that they come with. if you level a survivor up, you can unlock the ability to teach these perks to all of your other survivors. additionally, there's the shrine of secrets, which allows you to buy these teachable perks with a (FREE) in-game currency. this makes playing survivor a lot simpler, since once you've learned one, you've learned them all. killers, on the other hand, posses a different ability that cannot be used by any other killer. learning one does not allow you to play them all, meaning that it's a much more complicated experience. you also need to learn to do a lot of different things, such as pressuring the map, pressuring generators, aiming, chasing. knowing when to do certain things, etc. teams of survivors can win even if a few of them aren't good in chase as long as they're coordinated in their efforts to get the generators done. since it's a 1v4, the killer has to be fully rounded in their capabilities, otherwise they won't be able to win. because of this, the survivor side often has a much bigger draw on people than the killer side does.

so why does that matter? well, if you've got a bunch of people that want to play casually, and thus tend to go for playing survivor, you as a business guy need to make sure that they always have something to buy. there are a lot of cosmetics in the game. in fact, i believe that every survivor has cosmetics you can buy except for 2: quentin and bill. (and it could honestly only be a matter of time before they get stuff too, you never really know.) most survivors have a LOT of cosmetics too, usually at least a full page or two, especially if they aren't from a different property. as long as behaviour can easily make cosmetics for a character, they're going to do it. some characters get more than others, as they're more popular, but even then the less popular characters have a substantial collection. comparing this to killers, while only 1 killer lacks cosmetics that you can buy (freddy kreuger), not a single killer has as many cosmetics as the survivors with the most cosmetics. many have less than 5. nemesis, for example, launched with no cosmetics while his accompanying survivors, leon and jill, launched with 2 each. despite his frequent pick rate after release (due to the influx of new players that bought the resident evil dlc and the game at the same time), he only got a skin relatively recently, and it was just 1. meanwhile, leon and jill are receiving new cosmetics for christmas, which nemesis is not privy to. this is emblematic of the emphasis placed on what will get behaviour the most money. they release more paid content for the larger part of the playerbase, and make sure to do it at an incredibly rapid pace. skins are released faster than the patches for bugs, faster than hackers are banned, faster than new content that actually changes the gameplay. skins are THE priority for behaviour, and they rest above everything else. it also dabbles in frequent battlepass content, which is 100% cosmetic stuff, and that exclusivity and timed nature is a huge draw for paying customers. thus, dead by daylight is a money printing machine, and a very efficient one at that. according to some random website, behaviour's estimated annual revenue is 124.2 MILLION DOLLARS. dbd is really their only popular property, so the vast majority of that (theoretical) income is just dbd.

let's go back to talking about the gameplay. there is an immense skillgap among the players. the greatest killer mains can squish new survivors into the earth, and the greatest survivor mains can bully a new killer into literally quitting the game. it's very common for new killers to get recklessly tossed into games with top-rank survivors as the game decides their MMR (match making rating), and in turn, it's very common to see these killers delete the game off of their computer. it is intensely unfun to play badly against good survivors. at least if you're a survivor you'll just die and get into a different game, but survivors can hold the killer in a game for upwards of an hour, maybe more. the game caps off all matches at 2 hours, but that's still awfully long for a match that you're stuck in when you're having a horrible time. the game is set up to try its absolute best to prevent the killer from getting any more than 2 kills, since the supposed "perfect match" is 2 kills, 2 escapes. any time the killer gets more than those 2 kills, their MMR will skyrocket. this just isn't fun.

dbd's biggest problem is that it is very difficult to have fun when you're losing. losing on either side includes a lot of being immobilized, whether that's sitting on a hook or getting whacked over the head with a pallet. this is the cardinal sin of a video game, as what most people want to do when they play a game is to be able to play the whole time that you're in a match. survivors don't disconnect when the killer finds them in their hiding spot, they disconnect when they get downed and are about to be hooked. killers don't disconnect when a survivor escapes them in chase, they disconnect when they get DSed and have to sit there for 5 long, painful seconds while everyone gets away. it's like everything is designed to be plain annoying, with so many things constantly stopping you from moving. dead by daylight is simultaneously insanely difficult to enjoy and insanely addictive. everything feels like it's just out of your grasp, and maybe if you keep playing you'll get it this time. and to be fair, winning is very satisfying. whether you were able to run the killer around for 5 gens with your knowhow of looping or got great results from your trap setups, when everything comes together at the end of the game and you make your opponent(s) suffer a crushing defeat, you feel incredible.

in the grand scheme of things i don't have very many hours in the game. the best players tend to have 3,000 hours at the minimum, and i've seen people with over 10,000. people DO enjoy the game, but it's an uphill battle. and whoops i used up all th

This game has had a lot of issues through it's years, but personally I've always overlooked them because the game itself is fun, and it felt like the devs were at least trying their best. However, with the release of NFTs to coincide with the Hellraiser chapter, I really think they've become indefensible. The game currently is PLAGUED with issues, various issues have long gone unfixed such as inconsistent audio clipping, poor connection and server stability, rampant cheaters in every few matches. What do the devs do instead of fixing the game's flaws? They promote a scam to try and siphon even more money from a game that ALREADY HAS MICROTRANSACTIONS. Pure greed. 

I don't care if you think NFTs are fine or not, regardless, Behaviour's handling of this game is abhorrent. Earlier this week people asked them if the NFT rumors were true, and they replied nope! However, only a few days later, they've revealed that they lied! Flat out! Trust me, you don't want to play this game. The devs are untrustworthy, and truly incompetent when it comes to balance or fixes.

I regret every minute and cent I spent on this game. It continues to disappoint at every turn. I can't remember the last time they made a patch that didn't ruin some core mechanic in some way. Thanks for reading, and I hope you save your money :)
I sure do love when devs decide to go into scams like NFT, do not get this game at all

El juego merece la pena sobretodo teniendo en cuenta el precio (lo puedes encontrar por ahí a 4,5€), da horas y horas de diversión ya que cada partida es diferente y a día de hoy siguen añadiendo contenido nuevo (nuevos asesinos, mapas, habilidades..). Puedes encontrar tanto asesinos conocidos (Myers, Freddy, Némesis, Ghostface..) y asesinos propios del juego, además de sus respectivos supervivientes.

El único problema de este juego (quitando algún que otro bug o fallo después de alguna actualización) es sin duda la gente. Dead by daylight tiene una de las comunidades más tóxicas que he sufrido al nivel de necesitar parar de jugar si no quieres estampar el teclado.
Asesinos que te facecampean aun quedando 5 motores, que te tunnelean aunque se pongan los otros survis por en medio, survis que hacen teabag o que clickean con la linterna hasta desfallecer... por no hablar de los que únicamente se dedican a esconderse y no hacen nada en toda la partida.

Vamos, que el juego está 100% recomendado para jugar con amigos pero si juegas sólo, mejor ármate de paciencia.
